name: A Study of Imlunestrant Versus Standard Endocrine Therapy in Participants With Early Breast Cancer
description: The main purpose of this study is to measure how well imlunestrant works compared to standard hormone therapy in participants with early breast cancer that is estrogen receptor positive (ER+) and human epidermal receptor 2 negative (HER2-). Participants must have already taken endocrine therapy for two to five years and must have a higher-than-average risk for their cancer to return. Study participation could last up to 10 years.

ai.criteria: Have a diagnosis of ER+, HER2- early-stage, resected, invasive breast cancer without evidence of distant metastasis.

variables.display: Have a diagnosis of ER+, HER2- early-stage, resected, invasive breast cancer without evidence of distant metastasis.

ai.criteria: Participants must have received at least 24 months but not more than 60 months of any adjuvant ET, from time of adjuvant ET initiation.

variables.display: Participants must have received at least 24 months but not more than 60 months of any adjuvant ET, from time of adjuvant ET initiation.

ai.criteria: Participants may have received (neo) adjuvant chemotherapy and/or targeted therapy with a CDK4/6- or PARP- inhibitor.

variables.display: Participants may have received (neo) adjuvant chemotherapy and/or targeted therapy with a CDK4/6- or PARP- inhibitor.

ai.criteria: Must have an increased risk of disease recurrence based on clinical-pathological risk features.

variables.display: Must have an increased risk of disease recurrence based on clinical-pathological risk features.

ai.criteria: Have a Performance Status of 0 or 1 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group scale.

variables.display: Have a Performance Status of 0 or 1 on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group scale.

ai.criteria: Have any evidence of metastatic disease (including contralateral ALN) or inflammatory breast cancer at primary breast cancer diagnosis.

variables.display: Have any evidence of metastatic disease (including contralateral ALN) or inflammatory breast cancer at primary breast cancer diagnosis.

ai.criteria: Participants with more than a 6-month consecutive gap in therapy during the course of prior adjuvant ET.

variables.display: Participants with more than a 6-month consecutive gap in therapy during the course of prior adjuvant ET.

ai.criteria: Participants who have completed or discontinued prior adjuvant ET >6 months prior to screening.

variables.display: Participants who have completed or discontinued prior adjuvant ET >6 months prior to screening.

ai.criteria: Participants with a history of previous breast cancer are excluded, with the exception of ipsilateral DCIS treated by locoregional therapy alone >=5 years ago.

variables.display: Participants with a history of previous breast cancer are excluded, with the exception of ipsilateral DCIS treated by locoregional therapy alone >=5 years ago.

ai.criteria: Pregnant, breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the projected duration of the trial, starting with the screening visit through 180 days after the last dose of study intervention.

variables.display: Pregnant, breastfeeding, or expecting to conceive or father children within the projected duration of the trial, starting with the screening visit through 180 days after the last dose of study intervention.

ai.criteria: Participant has previously received ET of any duration for breast cancer prevention (tamoxifen or AIs) or raloxifene.

variables.display: Participant has previously received ET of any duration for breast cancer prevention (tamoxifen or AIs) or raloxifene.

ai.criteria: Participants with a history of any other cancer.

variables.display: Participants with a history of any other cancer.

ai.criteria: Have serious preexisting medical conditions that, in the judgment of the investigator, would preclude participation in this study.

variables.display: Have serious preexisting medical conditions that, in the judgment of the investigator, would preclude participation in this study.
